definition: current trends/the present situation/how things are going

sentences.english: The obsession with current events is relentless.
sentences.chinese: 對於時事的沉迷是冷酷的。

sentences.english: Are you getting a dozen email newsletters delivered to your inbox on a daily or weekly basis?
sentences.chinese: 每日或每週時事資訊郵件？

sentences.english: He was well informed and updated with all kinds of current affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他見多識廣，並且瞭解各種最新的時事新聞。

sentences.english: You can get your newsletters or bills over there.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在那裏瀏覽時事通訊或賬單。

sentences.english: The following appeared in an article from a popular newsmagazine.
sentences.chinese: 下述文字摘自某通俗時事雜誌的一篇文章。

sentences.english: They keep tuned in to current affairs.
She keeps track of the current events by watching television.
sentences.chinese: 她藉由看電視以隨時關心時事。

sentences.english: Your Mama's So stupid, it took her 2 hours to watch 60 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 你媽太笨了，她看“60分鐘時事”節目要2個小時。

sentences.english: Newspaper accounts of political and international affairs are often distorted.
sentences.chinese: 報紙上關於政治和國際時事的報道經常失實。

sentences.english: The second chapters "the definition of the current news work" divides into three sections.
sentences.chinese: 第二章“時事新聞作品的界定”共分爲三節。

sentences.english: I read the newspaper everyday and I'm up-to-date on current events.
sentences.chinese: 我每天看報紙，對時事要聞有所瞭解。

sentences.english: The second chapter introduce the subject matter of current affairs novels.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，介紹晚清時事小說的題材。

sentences.english: Communicate with supporters via a website and e-newsletters.
sentences.chinese: 通過網站和電子時事通訊來與支持者通話。

sentences.english: Learn about how to follow your parliament in the news.
sentences.chinese: 學會在時事新聞中跟隨你的議會。

sentences.english: The late-night current affairs programme has a new anchorman.
sentences.chinese: 夜間時事節目出現了一名新的主持人。

sentences.english: A: What do you think about his comment on the current news?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得他對時事新聞的評論如何？

definition: current politics/political situation of the time
to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
Gentlemen! (start of a speech)/Ladies and Gentlemen!
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
